reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a pretty solid monitor for the price of around 200usd. It's 1440p 165hz, curved screen with HDR. Wish it wasn't VA but it's still decent with the contrast and colors. I enjoy the sleek profile and the features are nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely great for gaming. Works wonderfully with a laptop, desktop and gaming consoles.
reviews.reviewText: Gigabyte managed to deliver a very decent gaming monitor that everyone can afford. Here i will tell my experience with 2 gaming consoles and 2 different computers.PC1: A gaming laptop that connected through HDMI can reach 1440p 144hz. The colors are powerful and accurate, but it will not get to use 165hz because of the HDMI limitations.PC2: A mini pc with a display port. it can get to use the 165hz without problem and 170hz if you overclock the monitor.Playstation 5: 1440p 120hz works wonderfully. it also outputs 2160p (4k) 60hz but in my opinion it doesn't worth it. Stick with 1440p. Also, HDR works too, i didn't like it in any device because it's extremely bright and looks pale, but you can try it if you want. Movies and games look beautiful without it anyway.Wii with HDMI adapter: I tried this one just to see how it handles low resolutions and the result is actually impressive. it does look pixelated of course, but better than an average monitor or HDTV, but never better than a CRT TV/monitor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The curve is beautiful.
reviews.reviewText: First time owning a curved monitor and I’m loving it. Great picture quality, responsiveness, all the good stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Really nice, no frills, solid product…
reviews.reviewText: These are really nice monitors with vibrant colorful picture from the box. Not much adjustment is needed. I dont like the 6axis color found on other GB monitors. These have sweet & simple adjustments. I’ve tried several monitors and brands, these are good. Then consider the price. ASUS also puts out nice color and controls. Some of the nicest scenes I’ve had without OLED. Its does dark scenes & vivid well. Only complaint is I wish the power cords were longer. But no biggie.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars G27QC: A Very Solid Budget 1440p Choice
reviews.reviewText: I was a little hesitant buying this monitor coming from a 7 year old LG IPS Ultrawide, but I needed higher refresh rates and 1440p at a decent price, and that led me to this monitor.So far, it's very good for the price.Things I'm most impressed with:-Black uniformity (Very good on my unit, especially for a curved VA panel)-Grey uniformity (Okay on my unit, above average for sure)-White uniformity (Absolutely perfect on my unit, 0 flaws)-Lack of backlight bleed (My unit has the slightest bleed in the top left and bottom right corners, but hardly noticeable.)-Zero dead pixels-Fast Pixel Response (It is much faster than the LG, even being VA, VA has come a long way! There is some blur, but nothing that bothers me as it's much better than my previous monitor. My unit passes the blur busters test with ease to the naked eye)-Color accuracy (I haven't officially tested it, it out of the box stock settings seem to be pretty accurate to my eye, I changed the settings though as I like the oversaturated look)-Overdrive settings (Previous reviews from Tech Channels when this product first came out always mentioned improperly calibrated Overdrive settings. Gigabyte seems to have fixed this on the newest models, I have noticed no issues using the "balanced" overdrive mode @165Hz)-Overall Brightness (This thing punches well above 250 nits, other reviewers on their units have cited 320 nits, mine feels even higher, potentially pushing 350+ nits peak brightness. It can hurt my eyes in the dark)-Useful extras included (Gigabyte includes 3 separate power cables (for different countries), a DP cable, and an HDMI cable. Decent quality cables as well, nice bonus.)-Great packaging, assembly was super quick and straightforward. Only thing that got me stuck was releasing the spring tension from the monitor arm. There is a small piece of black plastic keeping the spring tension, I first tried to remove it without releasing the spring tension, that was a no go. Once you push up on the stand and release the tension, the plastic falls out with ease and the monitor arm snaps back how it's supposed to, and you can install the stand. It's ready to go after that.The not so good:-G-Sync flicker. (It flickers bad, and I'm still trying to diagnose it. Some games do, and others don't, so it might not be the monitor. To my understanding, ALL G-Sync monitors flicker, some less than others. So far, playing around with a few settings has helped reduce it, I will update if I find a way to completely mitigate the flicker. I also have not tried a different DP cable, that might fix it as well. I'm not putting this issue against the monitor just yet as many other trusted reviewers mentioned G-Sync working fine on their units.)-Annoying port placement (Ports and IO is on the bottom of the monitor, serious design oversight. Very difficult to plug things in, you have to reach under the monitor and do it blind.)-That's it that I can find so far, if any issues arise in the future I will update the review accordingly.Something worth mentioning:-The seller (Amazon in my case) is supposed to stamp the warranty card with the purchase date. If they do not (Of course they didn't, even though the box arrived opened, indicating that they did!!!!) your warranty begins from date of manufacture, not date of purchase. This is super annoying as I just lost a year of warranty coverage thanks to Amazon refusing to stamp the warranty card.Final thoughts: Overall, fantastic budget 1440p 27" curved VA high refresh rate monitor. For the price I paid ($270 + tax), it is 110% worth it. Great upgrade coming from an older (2014-2015) LG IPS Ultrawide panel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Completely worth. Amazing monitor.
reviews.reviewText: It's even better than I thought it would be, I love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Gigabyte Monitor Review- DO NOT BUY
reviews.reviewText: Review may potentially changed as I’m getting a second monitor today but as of now with the first one I ordered I can say the monitor itself is good aside from one glaring issue. Mine came with a scratch on the LCD panel, it is very small so I almost didn’t notice it at first until I was looking at the sky in-game and there I saw it, in effectively the middle of the monitor a couple mm gash on the display, whether it be through shipping or if it just got past quality control at Gigabyte or Amazon I didn’t pay $200 for a new monitor for it to have a scratch on the panel upon arrival. PS. will update review with picture of said scratch today after I’m off work, then send a picture of the new one however it turns out. So the second monitor is also has a defect being a smear mark underneath the panel itself, completely disappointed and will never purchase another monitor from Gigabyte returning both ASAP and hoping Amazon will refund me. Pictures are of the 2nd monitor with the smear mark the one with the scratch on the panel is in the box and I’d rather not get it out when I’m returning it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Detail is a real improvement!
reviews.reviewText: Great detail and picture. I like the slight surround angle, its just right and not too much angle. The adjustable stand definitely helps for all uses.

One of best monitor I’ve bought so far. Playing on ps5 and on pc, and you can really enjoy that 165 Hz (or 120 for ps5). The picture’s quality is top notch, no issue with the brightness. Everything is smooth, lot of cables that comes with it for any country. Great brand, great monitor for gaming !

Excelente monitor, es más grande de lo que aparenta, llega a reescalar 4k en Xbox a 1ms Perfecto para campañas y multijugador. El HDR hace buen trabajo en algunos juegos, recomendable desactivar el hdr automático

El monitor corre perfectamente los 120hz a 1440 en Ps5 solo recuerden de tener el cable original del Ps5 o un cable compatible con HdMI 2.1 , y importante actualizar el monitor en su página de gigabyte está el software y la actualización para que pueda detectar la Ps5 a 1440 y 120hz ,ojo que no todos los juegos corren a 120hz y en en el menú del play se detecta a 1440 a 60 hz pero una vez inicies un juego corre perfecto a 120hz y 1440 p , lo único malo es que el monitor sufre algo de bleeding partes blancas en las esquinas pero solo cuando está sin señal la pantalla , al jugar o ver lo que sea este desaparece y se ve espectacular es un deleite ver la calidad de imagen ya que también escala a 4k a 60hz en ps5
Excelente Marca y características.Permite largas cesiones de trabajo sin fatiga. 👍

Buen monitor, tiene buenos colores de acuerdo a su clasificación, o sea, tiene buenos colores para ser VA.Cumple con todo lo que dice en la descripción, por lo que lo considero un buen producto.Sin embargo, no puede girarse la pantalla de lado a lado, sólo puede moverse de arriba a abajo, pero ese contra se puede arreglar con un nuevo soporte.
